result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael F. Nelson was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael F. Nelson in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:08
Plea questionnaire filed - No contest plea to OWI #4 as misdemeanor -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty - Count 2 dismissed as matter of law
Michlig/Drewa- provides def exhibit 1(letter from treatment counselor) /Defendant/ Court statement to sentencing
Court WHS and POP For 3 years-   1 year IID/30 month Revocation of DL/ Driver assessment - 
FIne/costs totalling $2605  plus $35 blood test fee($1000 bond posted to apply) -45 days jail - huber for all purposes to commence on/before 8-1-15 4pm . Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given -
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-15-2015 03:00 pm

03:33 pm - Defendant Michael F. Nelson in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to OWI 4th offense a misdemeanor.  Michlig statement to motion, references State V Brown - If case were to proceed to motion hearing - arresting officer cannot remember if one or both lights were burned out - defendant maintains only one light was defected - this was the primary basis for the stop.  Court would need to determine if the one light illuminating the license plate would be good enough.   Parties stipulate at least one light was illuminating the license plate.  Under 967.015 - Court finds the proposed amendment is in the public's best interest/State's ability to prosecute is compromised and grants the amendment motion.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Part of Motion
to Suppress Evidence and Derivative Use - Illegal Stop

04:04 pm - Defendant Michael F. Nelson in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Drewa in receipt of Amended Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment held January 21, 2015
Preliminary Hearing held December 8, 2014

01:19 pm - Defendant Michael F. Nelson in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court statement to status of case.  Drewa statement to filing of appeal - Drewa/Michlig statement motion for dismissal.  Court statement to motion - Information filed in timely manner which was acceptable to Defense which charged a misdemeanor instead of the felony originally charged.  Defense is/was going to file an  interlockatory appeal.  Court will draft an order consistent with ruling from previous appearance ording the State to file an Information consistent with the orginal charge.  Court denies defense motion to dismiss.  Drewa/Michlig statement to motion regarding waiving of preliminary hearing - requests restoring case prior to the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Arraignment on January 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
of Preliminary Hearing

09:13 am - Defendant Michael F. Nelson in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information.  Court sets over for an arraignment.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael F. Nelson in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

In receipt, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - 
Court will withdraw and transfer to Br II  - Drewa to obtain court date from JA in Br II - Time limits waived
Drewa to bail - Bednar to bail - Court continues bail as set -
